III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility does not have enough staff as they were unable to
pick a youth up from extra-curricular activities.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at school on 12/10/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she
called the facility on 12/3/2024 and had to wait one and a half
hours to be picked up after wrestling practice. Youth A reported
Coach called the facility, Youth A did not know who Coach
communicated with, however staff stated they were on the way.
Youth A reported she waited twenty minutes and called the facility
again and was told staff was on the way. Youth A reported she
waited forty minutes and called the facility again and was told staff
was on the way. Youth A reported she stood outside waiting to be
picked up for one and a half hours. Youth A reported she walked
to the store and got a water and walked back to the school. Youth
A reported this is the longest she has ever waited to be picked up.
Youth A reported Supervisor arrived and picked her up.
Youth A reported there was a time when practice ended a few
minutes early and she had to wait outside for twenty minutes to be
picked up.
Youth A reported on 12/5/2024 Staff 1 refused to pick her up as
Staff 1 stated her shift ended at 10pm. Youth A reported Staff 1
text Supervisor to pick up Youth A however Youth A reported she
knew it would take Supervisor a while to pick her up. Youth A
reported she arrived back at the school around 11:30pm from her
wresting tournament and Supervisor arrived to pick her up around
12am. Youth A reported she sat in a friend’s car until Supervisor
arrived to pick her up. Youth A originally said she called the
facility around 10:30pm to say she would be back in an hour and
then stated she was unsure of the time she called as the wrestling
2

tournament was in a different time zone. Youth A reported she
does not think Supervisor should be transporting her as it is
“staff’s job”.
Youth A reported sometimes she has a friend who is approved
drop her off at the facility after practice. Youth A reported she is
supposed to let the facility know after school/before practice starts
if she is going to need a ride back to the facility from practice.
Youth A reported practice runs from 4:30-6:30pm.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Chief Administrator reported not being aware of any times where
Youth A was standing outside alone waiting for a ride back to the
facility after wrestling. Chief Administrator reported Supervisor
picked Youth A up and Youth A was waiting in the gym with other
youth. Chief Administrator reported Youth A is approved to
receive rides home from Coach or a friend of hers. Youth A will
tell the staff she is getting a ride with Coach or her friend and wait
until last minute and state she needs a ride. The issue this leads
to is the school is at minimum twenty minutes from the facility with
clear roads. Chief Administrator reported the facility has since
obtained Coach’s contact information and is communicating
directly with Coach.
Director of Residential Services was interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on 12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker. Director of Residential Services reported the facility is
actively working on a plan to address the transportation for Youth
A from wrestling. If there is not an extra staff that is an approved
driver on shift, then on-call is called in to transport Youth A.
Director of Residential Services reported Youth A is supposed to
notify the facility one hour prior to needing a ride and is reminded
of that every morning on the way to school. Director of
Residential Services reported the issue on 12/5/2024 was Youth A
had told staff Coach would be bringing her to the facility after the
wrestling tournament and then last minute called to say she
needed a ride. Director of Residential Services reported the plan
moving forward is staff will plan to pick Youth A up from all
practices and after tournaments unless the facility receives a
confirmation from Coach or the approved friend stating they are
transporting Youth A to the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported Youth A called law enforcement last week while on her
3

way back from a wrestling tournament in Norway alleging staff
were neglecting her by not picking her up from the school after the
wrestling tournament. Staff 1 reported Youth A called the facility
on 12/5/2024 around 9pm and said the bus was leaving Norway to
head back to the school. Staff 1 informed Youth A she was off
work at 10pm and would let Supervisor know the timeframe
window and a staff would be at the school to pick Youth A up.
Staff 1 told Youth A to have Coach text Supervisor as the bus got
closer so Supervisor could plan appropriately. Staff 1 reported ten
to fifteen minutes later law enforcement called the facility due to
Youth A alleging neglect. Staff 1 reported the plan was for
Supervisor to pick Youth A up if it was going to be after 10pm.
Staff 1 reported she called and let Supervisor know about
approximate pick-up time.
Staff 1 reported Youth A has a friend that is approved to give her
rides after practice. Youth A is supposed to call and let the facility
know when her friend is unable to provide her a ride in order for
staff to know to pick Youth A up after practice. Staff 1 reported
there has never been any times when no staff were able to go get
Youth A. Staff 1 reported there was one time where Youth A had
to wait approximately thirty minutes as the weather was bad and
the school is approximately twenty minutes away from the facility.
Staff 1 did not recall the date of this incident however reported
Youth A was waiting inside at the school.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/10/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported she works at the house and recently began working at
the facility. Staff 2 reported when she has worked and Youth A
has wrestling, staff pick Youth A up after practice. Staff 2 reported
twice during her shifts Youth A has been picked up by Supervisor,
Chief Administrator or Director of Residential Services. Staff 2 had
no knowledge of Youth A not being picked up timely.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 1/2/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported 12/3/2024
Youth A had wresting practice after school and the facility was
under the impression Youth A was going to be brought home by
Coach as Youth A had been receiving rides from him. Staff 3
reported Youth A called the facility and reported she needed a
ride. Staff 3 reported Supervisor was on-call and was contacted
to go get Youth A as there were not enough staff at the facility to
maintain ratio if a staff left to go get Youth A. Staff 3 reported he
did not recall if Supervisor was at the facility working or at home
when she was contacted to go get Youth A. Staff 3 reported he
4

did not recall what time Youth A returned to the facility from
Supervisor picking her up. Staff 3 reported the facility will utilize
on-call to assist with transportation when needed and had the
facility known Youth A would need a ride, it would have been
planned out. Staff 3 reported on 12/5/2024 the facility had
planned to pick Youth A up after she returned from her wresting
tournament. Staff 3 reported the plan the facility had arranged
was for Supervisor who was on-call to pick Youth A up at the
school and Supervisor did. Staff 3 reported Youth A has been
picked up from wresting practice and tournaments or received
rides back to the facility from individuals approved to transport her.
Coach was interviewed via telephone on 12/17/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Coach reported the only
instance with Youth A not having a ride after practice that he was
aware of was on 12/3/2024. Coach reported he spoke back and
forth via telephone with Supervisor however Coach did not know if
it was due to a timing issue or miscommunication. Coach
reported he told Youth A to remain at the school inside as there
was another event going on at the school and Supervisor was on
her way to pick up Youth A. Coach reported when he left the
school, he saw Youth A walking to the gas station, and he pulled
up next to her and reminded her to go back to the school as
Supervisor was on the way to pick her up. Coach reported Youth
A never had to stand and wait outside for her ride to pick her up
as he always lets the kids into the building after tournaments to
wait for rides or after practice. Coach reported Youth A’s last
wrestling tournament was away and when they arrived back at the
school Youth A’s ride was there waiting. Coach reported he and
the staff at the facility communicate back and forth to arrange
times. Coach reported he does not provide Youth A rides due to it
being the opposite direction of his home.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on 12/202/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported she
was working at the facility on 12/3/2024 and there were also three
direct care staff working. On the shift that evening there was only
one direct care staff who was an approved driver for the facility,
and she was off campus with another youth at the walk-in clinic.
Supervisor reported Staff 3 asked her to go pick up Youth A as
Youth A initially told the facility she had a ride after practice and
then called stating she needed a ride. Supervisor reported she
left the facility at 6:30pm to go pick up Youth A. Supervisor
reported when she arrived at the school to pick up Youth A, Youth
A was inside the school with other youth. Supervisor reported she
believed she arrived to pick Youth A up around 6:50pm as the
5

school is about twenty minutes from the facility. Supervisor
reported on 12/5/2024, Youth A had told the facility that she was
going to get a ride from her approved friend or the coach after the
wresting tournament. Staff 1 and Staff 3 were working at the
house and Staff 1 was scheduled to work until 10pm and the plan
was for Staff 1 to pick Youth A up if she needed a ride after the
tournament. Supervisor reported Youth A was supposed to be
back around 9:30pm however the time changed until 10:30 to
11pm. Staff 1 called Supervisor around 9:30pm and notified
Supervisor of the time change for pick up as Staff 1 was off work
at 10pm. Supervisor reported she was on-call and told Staff 1 she
would pick Youth A up. Supervisor reported she left her house at
10pm to go pick Youth A up. Supervisor reported she lives
approximately thirty minutes from the school. Supervisor reported
the roads were very icy and she drove slow to the school.
Supervisor reported she arrived at the school around 10:45pm
and Youth A was sitting in a vehicle with someone else waiting for
her. Supervisor reported it has been difficult as Youth A will tell
staff she has a ride and then last-minute call the facility for a ride.
Supervisor reported the facility is now arranging to have staff pick
Youth A up after all practices and tournaments to avoid last
minute situations.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/3/2024 outside the house showed Youth A
arrived back at the facility with Supervisor at 8:29pm.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email dated 12/9/2024 from Foster Care Worker to
Consultant: Youth A was approved on 12/6/2024 by Foster
Care Worker to receive transportation from a teammate.
• Teaching Family Homes South Bluff Residential Group
Home Program Description: South Bluff is a therapeutic-
oriented residential that provides a supportive environment
for youth demonstrating non-lethal behaviors who are ready
for a least restrictive, family-like setting. Each youth’s
treatment focus is designed to meet their individual needs,
build on their strengths, and help them to achieve their goals
of returning to the least restrictive environment. The
community-based approach, along with clinical services,
helps to provide each child the opportunity to generalize the
skills, they are learning to new environments, foster
connections and gain skills for independence and self-
determination. The minimum staffing ratio of a Mental
Health Stabilization care is one direct care staff to two
6

youth during waking hours. Due to the ongoing needs of
the youth away from the program, including family
visitation, court hearings, medical appointments, etc.,
additional staff are needed to maintain the family-style
milieu and adequate case management. Support staffing
may be adjusted to meet the needs of the youth and
program.
• Safety Plan dated 1/2/2025 completed and signed by Chief
Administrator and MDHHS Worker stating staff will be
scheduled to pick Youth A up after practice and
tournaments and if alternative arrangements are made for
an approved person to provide transportation for Youth A
back to the facility, the facility will have direct contact with
the approved person to verify they will be providing the
transportation.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as the facility has the staff to
provide transportation to and from extracurricular activities for
Youth A and never refused to pick her up. Based on the
interviews, Youth A was approved to receive rides from her coach
as well as a teammate and the facility requested Youth A provide
timely notice if she was not going to receive a ride from her coach
or teammate so the facility could plan to provide the
transportation, which Youth A did not always provide timely notice
to the facility. The facility has opted to provide all transportation
for Youth A to eliminate last minute planning moving forward.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
